description: "Tomb of the Mask instantly got me hooked with its appealing combination of retro-style graphics, fast-paced gameplay, and dead-simple controls. In fact, if I didn’t have to write this post, I probably wouldn’t have stopped from playing it" - AppAdvice"I'm very impressed with how much I'm enjoying Tomb of the Mask" - TouchArcade"This modern arcade title charms with retro FX and visual sensibilities that communicate personality more than merely nostalgia" - Kill Screen "A challenging endless arcade game through trap-filled tombs" - Pocket GamerTomb of the Mask is an arcade game, which takes place in an infinite procedurally generated vertical labyrinth. Seeking for adventure you get into a tomb, where you find a strange mask. You wear it and suddenly realize that you can now climb walls - easily and promptly. And that's when all the fun begins. You'll face a variety of traps, enemies, game mechanics and powerups. And as far as time doesn't wait, get a grip and up you go!○○○SUBSCRIPTION PRICING AND TERMSSubscription optionsIn Tomb of the Mask we offer you the following subscription options:1. Weekly Diamond Membership offers a weekly subscription for $7.99 after a 3-day free trial. It gives you unlimited energy, 400 coins every day and removes ads.2. Monthly Diamond Membership offers a monthly subscription for $19.99. It gives you unlimited energy, 400 coins every day and removes ads.3. Yearly Diamond Membership offers a yearly subscription for $99.99. reviews:
|The game itself is fun, I like the movement, the traps, the sounds, the Pac-Man-esque style, but I have a few problems with it. For one, after around level 100, there are a few challenging levels, but pretty much from then on every level was repetitive and too easy. I preferred the challenge rather than just flying through level after level, putting limits on myself or else I would beat it too fast. Another problem is the ads: I know it’s how you make your money but showing an ad after literally every game is excessive. I watched some videos to open chests (because that’s pretty much the only way to finish the “open X chests” challenges without waiting for days on end) so having more ads on top of that is annoying. Finally I have issue with the “diamond membership” that you and a bunch of other games have been offering lately. $7.99 a WEEK for what, 4 masks you’ll never use, 400 coins per day, and no ads, which on any other game would cost like $3.99 once? Do you really think this game offers almost 4 times as much value as, say, Netflix, which charges like $9 a month? I would pay $7.99 ONCE for these things, maybe. I bet you offer the 3-day free trial so people sign up for it and forget to cancel, too. Having finished all the levels, I can say all in all that this is a fun game that could have been better executed if more effort was put into the levels and it weren’t muddled by greed.

|To make a long story short, I was introduced to this game after seeing my best friend and her cousin completely addicted to it. I was a little skeptical, but I tried it out on their phone after a brief demo of how it was played. Game play is simple- simply tap the screen and the hook will descend, leaving you nothing to do but swipe your finger across the screen to catch the fish. I have been playing this for a while now, and still find myself playing it a couple times a day. Yes, like other reviews you do see a lot of ads, mostly if you want to double your money to be able to dive deeper and earn more money while offline. While they don’t bother me too much, it’s a small price to pay rather than shelling out real money to upgrade. However, I do have a few suggestions I’d like to make to make the game a bit interesting. I’d like to go deeper, perhaps even encounter a Kraken or other big sea creatures. Maybe being able to unlock other fishing poles could help attract fish that are worth more or extremely rare. Also, maybe random things like treasure chests or a mermaid spotting would entice other player

description: Must use brain to finish all levels. It's easy to learn but very difficult to master.The job of each level is to guide a ball from a predetermined start point so that it touches all of the stars placed on the level. The ball and nearly all objects on the screen are affected by gravity. The first few levels are almost too easy, but as the difficulty increases you'll be thankful that you were able to practice the fundamentals of draw. As the game progresses, you'll have to use all sorts of theory to figure out a solution for each puzzle. The Game Features:- Hundreds of ways to solve each puzzle, can you find the best solution?- 200+ of physics puzzles, more levels are coming soon!- Flexible thinking is going to become the key to victory.- Solutions can be found in the end of each level.- Play 100+ of challenging- Interesting physics puzzles, they're not as easy as they look.If you have any questions or comments, feel free to contact us at cashgamesteam@gmail.com Privacy Policy and Terms of use：http://www.hellostars.net/privacy.html

And whenever I get less than 3 stars on a level, there is an annoying pop-up that is like, “watch an ad to get 3 stars?” Or something like that. And it said #1 time killer, but it’s more like #1 time waster. I wasted a lot of my time and in the ad it had like a way better version of this game. And the beginning has nothing to do with the subject at all :(. It just had a stick an that walked onto a stage and started dancing randomly. And I think the only reason you have to complete the boring puzzles is just to get a bunch of useless coins to upgrade your dance moves and stuff, which is weird. And I don’t get it why on like every single stage it always HAS to have a sleeping guy that is doing a random hobby. |Ok so when I first opened the app, I was confused when I saw a random stick figure dancing on a stage. Basically the whole game revolves around getting coins in which you can use to... upgrade your stage and dancer? You gain coins by either watching ads, paying money, or doing puzzles. All of the puzzles have basically one goal, get the ball to a specific object or person(usually either a star or a sleepy man). These puzzles are quite fun at first, but they just get quite repetitive and annoyingly hard to understand. They aren’t satisfying to complete and don’t give you enough coins. For example, paying 99 cents will get you 1,800 coins, while one challenge (which sometimes can take a few minutes if your trying to get a 3 Star) will give you 30. Also watching one ad can get you 200 coins. After every other puzzle you complete a skippable ad will pop up and an option to watch an ad for a reward will come up. After about 30 minutes of playing I just said to myself, what is the point of this if the reward isn’t even satisfying?(which it isn’t) Well then I though that is was just to kill time and have fun while doing so. But there are so many apps out there that do this soooo much better, and they are actually fun to play. Don’t waste your time with this app, please.

reviews:
|This is the best and easiest way I can message anyone! I can message, call, FaceTime, see when people are active, etc.! I’ve never had any problems whatsoever. I was just curious about one thing. Sometimes, I’ll be sending a message to someone, even though they’re not active. Here’s what I’m curious about. There’s that little green circle, showing that someone’s active or was active a certain amount of time ago. All the time...when someone was active a certain amount of time ago, it won’t show it until later. For example...I’ve messaged someone around 12:30 P.M. one time. It didn’t have the green circle, saying they were active or active a certain amount of time ago. Then, 20 minutes later (12:50), a green circle popped up on them, saying they were active 50 minutes ago (12:00, which is 30 minutes before I sent them a message). Also, another thing I’m curious about is still with the green light. It won’t show that they’re active when they actually are active. I was just was curious about that. I’m not complaining about this, at least I’m not trying to. I apologize if I am. But, I was curious about it. It’s been happening for a few years. This app definitely deserves 5 stars and above.

|I loved messenger when I could choose who and when I wanted to message someone. I’m a singer, so lots of people want to friend me on Facebook so they can follow my posts. Now when I accept a friend request, I’m bombarded with notifications to wave or say hi to my new friend. Also, Facebook is not a dating or hook up site for me. When I accept a friend, I control what they can see for a reason... I don’t want to get personal with them. Now my notification icon blows up with stuff I would get on a dating site.. hey beautiful, you’re so sexy, etc. I hate it!! One night I was cooking dinner for my family and my phone started going off with a weird notification ring I never heard before. My husband picked it up and it was another man calling my phone through messenger! These people don’t have my phone number for a reason. I only give it out to those who need it. Now any random person can call me through the app without having my phone number. Facebook is constantly changing things so I can’t keep up with this type of new feature so I was very surprised This is a great app for cheating on your spouse, if you’re into that. I don’t have time to accept a friend request, then go block every one of them on messenger, especially if I just accepted a bunch of new friends. Now I have hundreds of friend request sitting in notifications all because I don’t have time to follow through blocking them on messenger. Messenger is a Super invasion on my personal life... it was deleted!

|Look, the app does what it’s supposed to do. It’s a platform for contacting my FB friends and it does that just fine. Hence the two stars. However, with every single other app I own, you can opt out of notifications just once and never get asked again. I don’t like unnecessary notifications clogging up my phone all day long. I don’t want messenger notifications. EVERY TIME I log into the app, a pop up reminder comes up reminding me that my notifications are off and prompting me to turn them on. Even when I dismiss this alert, there’s a notification (little red circle with a number one in it) next to my photo on the app that is also a reminder to turn on my notifications. The red circle never goes away. And now just this week I’ve started getting an alert in red at the top of my messenger inbox letting me know that my notifications are not on. I find all of this very annoying and over the top. This issue in and of itself makes me want to delete the app. If I don’t want notifications then leave me alone! Why is it so important to this app that it’s forcing me to get notifications? Someone turn this off for goodness sakes.

reviews:
|This game is pretty addicting once you figure out how to knock other balls off. It took me a while to figure out that the longer you hold down, the more power you have when you let off. Although, this can be a huge disadvantage if you don’t aim carefully. Through figuring this out, I also noticed a bug where, if you hit another ball too hard, it will launch it outside of the map; causing you to not get a kill, and the bot is technically still alive, so you can’t win at that point even if you knock the rest off. I also found out, that if you miss and launch too hard, you can fly off the map and keep falling into a never ending “abyss”, forcing you to close the game and re-open it(the only way I’ve found to restart). Now these are fairly minor bugs if you think about it, yes it can be a little annoying but since I’m at the current highest rank(Master 1) it’s not a huge deal to win or lose. Which brings me to another point; I feel like leveling up each time you win is sort of too easy, since there’s only 20ish ranks. Maybe add a points system for every kill and every win which will help you level, and also give you some kind of currency to buy different skins and whatnot. Regardless of the points of possible improvement to be made, I still enjoy it and will continue to play.

|This is a fun game that needs minor bug fixes and a bit more content that I’m sure will be implemented in the near future. :)Tl;dr! ^__^I saw that my cousin played this game, and it looked pretty fun, so I decided I would try it. It’s a great and fun game, but it needs some changes and upgrades. I am aware that this is a fairly new game and it may take a while to make it better! First, there should be more ranks added. I reached the highest rank (Master 1) in just half a day. Also, there should be a point system based on your kills so you don’t level up every round. Next, I think there should be better and cooler skins. For example, skins with patterns and designs! Maybe these can be bought with coins that you would also get based on kills. Finally, BUGS! This game is new and obviously a bit buggy, but I honestly haven’t had to deal with much. The only big bug that I’ve had to deal with is how smaller players can knock you off the map, and how bigger players can knock you all the way across the map and off the other side! I bet that the people behind this great game are going to fix and update this game in the future. I know I’ll wait!

|This review is for all those people who feels like this is the worst game ever. Yes, this game is a basic game and it’s one that just came out. Any game that just starts up will always have bugs to work out and work towards adding new stuff to it. If none of you have figured this out yet, you live in a land of make believe. 99.9% of free games will have ads in them and if you don’t like it, turn on airplane mode or something like that. People complain about minute long ads on here, I have been able to close out of every ad within about 5-10 seconds, with most being 5 seconds. Sorry if you can’t figure that one out, life is already hard but if you can’t figure something that simple out, I am very sorry. If you have an issue with the fact that when you’re the same size as the other bot and you both push each other the same distance and it seems like a stalemate, try a different strategy (meaning, take a different approach at trying to knock the bot off). You’re not going to win every single time. It took me about half a day to get to master 1 (highest current level), so it’s not that hard.

Share a shortlist of options and vote in real-time• Create lists of your favorite places and share with friends• Follow must-try places recommended by local experts, Google, and publishersMore experiences on Google Maps• Offline maps to search and navigate without an internet connection• Street View and indoor imagery for restaurants, shops, museums and more• Indoor maps to quickly find your way inside big places like airports, malls and stadiums* Some features not available in all countries

reviews:
|This app does an above-average job at assisting in navigation. I like that it apparently integrates user movement over time; for example, when I moved to my house, it ignored a pedestrian footpath to the other half of my street, but it now no longer routes me two miles away when I’m going to the bus. The reason I don’t give it five stars is its integration with Lyft/Uber, because my pocket would open the links and sometimes nearly summon a car (I had to delete them to avoid being charged), and because of transit system shortcomings. GMaps doesn’t offer enough different choices for routes, sometimes missing obvious bus lines or transfers, sometimes only giving one option it thinks best, though I might know more info and want to prompt more choices, which isn’t possible. I a forced to enter fake destination or origin information to force other routes to display. One bus may be very crowded at certain times, one route may have a steep hill. It needs to offer a way to expand route choices. Also, I still need to use OneBusAway to check on arrival times, as GMaps is not always current, especially with detours and alterations. As for driving, it’s fine, except the way it ignores neighborhood shortcuts and alternatives. Overall, a good tool to assist you, but you need your own knowledge to make it truly effective. Therefore, 3.5 stars, which I weighted up to 4.

|Google Maps took over ALL the space in the market to substitute MapQuest and all those bulky GARMIN GPS devices that you had to pay to update the maps and was very complicated to do so, even if you wanted to pay for them. Google Maps also ‘killed’ all those country specific maps that you had to buy every year you went out to Europe. Google Maps scored the biggest accomplishment to defeat Apple Maps in their own home device natural platform, no Apple iPhone lover will use the Apple Maps, they preferred to download the Google Maps App and move Apple Maps to some far far away screen where no one could see it. Then Wase came around with a different approach, the community sharing navegador, but still Google Maps was the KING of the map applications domain. And now, the very self Google Developers and Marketers are “destroying with their feet, what they made with their hands”... by converting the former wonderful best in the world and in its class navigation app into a silly shopping mall on the road, taking 1/3 of the screen to show the navigator all this distractions that defeat the purpose of using the app to get to our destination fast, faster. Yeah! They should change the icon for a new one with a ‘restaurant’ feeling. On top of that, I would like to know the statistics that supported the decision to add the ‘car pooling’ option, really?How about returning to us, the users, our beloved original easy to use “Google Maps”.Thank You..!

|I have been using google maps since 2011. I never write reviews but this app has surpassed my expectations. I have tried waze, ios maps and they dont do it for me. I am a truck driver by trade and aside from truck route maps on a desktop, i always use google maps. Will google maps ever be perfect? No but we are talking about perfect cellphone service and non hesitant location tracking to have a perfect gps. Depending where you are and who your carrier is, your cell reception might be shakily and you might miss a turn, not the app’s fault. Once google introduced the option for additional stops with in your route, they locked in my loyalty to the app. The reason why i wrote this review today is a new option that i have long awaited. Since i drive for miles, i am always on the app. I also am always listening to music. Of course i have had many times where i missed that very important turn because i was skipping or searching for a new song. Not anymore, maps now has a very simple tab on the map that lets me skip my song with my maps still on the screen. Thats a game changer for me. Once again, google has made me a pleased customer. Great work.

|I love the selection of movies Netflix has. I also love that I can watch movies everywhere. However there are two "updates" that I feel actually set this app back. First I really hate that I can't rate movies and shows I watch by star ratings, unless I log in on an old device that doesn't have updates, or a computer. If I just watched it on my device or smart TV, I want to be able to rate it there. Unfortunately now the rating is only a thumbs up or down. I don't like how limited that is. I might like a movie, but not love it, or not really want to see it again for a while, however with the thumbs up, unless I remember everything about the movie I won't know how much I liked it. So now I feel unless I love a movie I have to give it a thumbs down. So personally I give a huge thumbs down to this new way of rating. I think it is definitely a downgrade. Second I wish on the new updates it would say if a show or movie is being taken off. For example I was watching one of my shows on my old Wii (which hasn't updated the software in a really long time), and on my Wii it told me that my show was only going to be available until October 9th. However when I turned the same show on my smart TV, and IPhone it didn't say anything. It would just be nice to see if the movie or show you're watching is going to be removed within the next month or so.

|I love Netflix BUT they stop one of my shows and it was a cliffhanger and it was mad in 2015 you think by now you you would put on the 3 season but no come on I Watch it over and over hoping you would put it on Netflix please Netflix i love the show please bring it back I watch it every day till it stopped I hope this will make you bring the 3 season if you don’t well I probably will not go on Netflix because it is a wast of my time and what would I do sit on Netflix not satisfied wow Netflix that is low even for you so please please read this if you do thank you so much I will tell you the name of the show do you want to make me happy and i will leave a bad review so please please please I am begging you to it will make me happy I put 5 ⭐️ so Netflix please please put the 3 season of some assembly required I love that show I am making this so long for you you please I will write reviews that are really good if you put it on there I am a little girl and I love this show and it makes me laugh it mite not be so popular but please you care don’t you once again it is called ⭐️ some assembly required ⭐️ please it is hard to explain but I love that show and I was really sad when it stopped if I were you I would make the little girl happy ps me

|I’m a huge entertainment buff whether it be games or movies. It’s just how I pass my free time when I’m not working. Netflix provides a endless amount movie I wouldn’t usually find on other other apps but if that was all it would be maybe ⭐️⭐️⭐️ to me because that’s nothing special. What makes Netflix a ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ you ask? Why is Netflix The Goat? To put it simply they never stop trying to entertain you, raising the bar through originals that other platforms would only wish to be tall enough to reach. Just going to give you one of many creative concepts Netflix has recently added that inspired me to write this. It’s Called “Black Mirror- Bandersnatch”. A movie based of their “original” hit series. This movie is a psychological thriller that on its own would be another hit putting another notch on the already crowded belt of this Powerhouse. This is the kicker though, you interact with this movie. Thats right, combining the movie experience with a video gaming feel! Oh and the movie has a gamer theme to it adding to the anxiety and pressure to make the right choices. I’m not going to ruin this for you but I really hope you experience this where you don’t just press play you’re playing. Netflix, shaking the pillars. BRAVO 👏

reviews:
|I was enjoying the game and was able to overlook all the mistakes in the game -- not recognizing or giving credit for words that are the correct number of letters, using words that would not be found in any scrabble dictionary, etc. Clearly the game was written by somebody who is not a native English speaker. And that was fine because I liked being able to get free diamonds (to help me figure out words, especially improper words 🙄) by watching a 6 or 15 second commercial video. And those videos actually worked I've actually purchased 4 of the advertised products! While other games 30 second commercial videos make me promise to never buy those products! (I can forgive a few 30 second videos in this game but with the latest update there are more and they are annoying.) But with this latest update and not having the opportunity to easily get as many free diamonds the game is just aggravating because it doesn't work right so I'm going to have to quit it. The free diamonds for watching videos tab actually disappears when you tap on it and the free diamonds under the + up the right-hand corner does not work at all, and the x 10 diamonds when you open up the game does not work most of the time anymore. So rather than be annoyed I'll just quit it at level 1233. You were fun but then you just became tedious. Farewell!

|I hate how this app makes you swipe from letter to letter when creating words because a lot of times, it doesn’t recognize the swipe, making you get the word wrong and having to redo it more carefully. A lot of times you have to press down really hard to make it comprehend what you’re swiping. I also highly dislike how you can get bonus words in each round, but sometimes the game doesn’t recognize a real word as a bonus word. For example, you can have a group of three-letter words, and you may go through several three-letter bonus words before you figure out which one actually fits their blocks. I’m working on one of the puzzles right now that has several three-letter words, but when I tried “elf” it wouldn’t take it as part of the puzzle nor a bonus word. And I swear this game makes up some words! I also don’t like how you can’t select which box you’d like the hint to go in; it just goes in order from beginning to end. I didn’t realize how much I hated this app until sitting down to write this, but the fact I felt compelled to write a review in the first place should’ve told me something.

|It’s ok... but there are several gaping holes in the game. The worst of these being, the developers of this game obviously don’t have a very good grasp on the English language. There are way too many words they don’t recognize that are widely accepted and common words. Another being they actually use words that aren’t proper “Scrabble”-type words, such as country and personal names. One such puzzle had Jamaica as the largest word to discover, and yet didn’t accept the word jam, when there was three letter words to be found. I understand not having the word as one of the main words of the puzzle, but when you are supposed to be able to collect “extra words” for diamonds it’s frustrating when perfectly good words aren’t accepted. Its ok for wasting time as I said, but with so many games, exactly like it, with a much better dictionary of words, I don’t see the point. Before the devs send me the same response to this review as has been sent before, stating that I can contact support at such and such a site with uncollected words, don’t bother. It’s just easier to download a game with the words already in its system with the exact same gameplay.

description: The official Gmail app brings the best of Gmail to your iPhone or iPad with real-time notifications, multiple account support and search that works across all your mail.With the Gmail app, you can:• Undo Send, to prevent embarrassing mistakes• Switch between multiple accounts• Get notified of new mail fast, with notification center, badge and lock screen options• Search your mail faster with instant results, predictions as you type & spelling suggestions• Swipe to archive/delete, to quickly clear out your inbox• Read your mail with threaded conversations• Auto-complete contact names as you type from your Google contacts or your phone• Respond to Google Calendar invites right from the app• Organize your mail by archiving, labeling, starring, deleting and reporting spam• Send and receive attachments• See profile pictures as part of the conversation

,  Yahoo Mail - Stay Organized

reviews:
|I swiped on an email heading and the email disappeared. It never told me what it was doing with the email. Did it delete it? Did it archive it? Did it forward it to my grandma? I had no idea. So I looked for the undo button. Oh, there ISN'T one. I shook the phone, which works in EVERY OTHER APP, it's a basic iPhone function. Nope. That didn't work either. I found the email still there under "All Mail" but there was no way to undo the archive and put it back into my primary folder, at least no way that was immediately intuitive. So that was super frustrating. Also, there is no "mark unread from here" in an email conversation. So if I mark something as unread, the entire email chain gets marked as unread. This is ridiculous. I sometimes have conversations with clients that have 50 emails back and forth. I don't want to have to go through them all again. Unfortunately, the built-in iPhone mail app does the same thing. But at least it has an undo function. I have gotten to where I rarely check email on my phone because there isn't yet a good app to deal with it. It used to be simple and it used to work. Now with all the folders and functions, replacing basic functionality, it just makes it a pain. Companies always try to fix things that aren't broken and just break them in the process. So this app is deleted. And I will go back to using the iPhone mail app to scan the previews and go to my Mac to actually reply.

|I have been using email for quite some time now and I have found Gmail to be far superior than any other email service I have used in the past. The ability to ORGANIZE important emails with labels and stay on top of my inbox and archives gives me a personal edge. For professional documentation of conversations with Government Officials and other Professional Organizations, I have been able to quickly retrieve important conversations that have supported my position and even helped me win disputes. Speaking of “search ability”, there have been occasions where I may have forgotten an individual’s EXACT name or exact email address, but knew I had it somewhere; all I had to do was put an “@“ symbol in the search box and a “portion” of the organization’s name or something else in the search criteria and the correct email address or variations thereof “surfaces from the ETHER” which makes life so much easier being able to find ALL CONVERSATIONS associated with that email address! I can then properly label or categorized all correspondences with that email address for future reference. KEEP THINKING OUTSIDE OF THE BOX WITH YOUR IMPROVEMENTS AND UPGRADES, IT IS WORKING!!!

|I use my iPad for work, as I need to take high resolution videos and have quick access to apps. The Gmail app has such terribly limited usability in key areas. First, it is crazy that I cannot create bulleted or numbered lists. This seems like a key component to writing succinct emails and I am not sure why this is not included. Second, I cannot copy and paste tables from other Google apps and keep the formatting! We send programs to clients that we create in Google sheets, but we do not need to send the entire sheet at one time, only a part. You simply cannot do this without creating an entirely new sheet, and then sharing it with them, which is simply not functional. I would rather be able to copy and paste the section of the sheet that is necessary to use. Lastly, the emails I send from my iPad do not have the same formatting as the desktop site. Again, I am at a loss as to why this is the case. We have a specific signature that we need to use in order to send protected information, and I have to set this signature up again instead of it carrying over from my desktop accessibility. The only good thing about this app is that I can access my email from it. However, it severely limits my ability to send useful emails and this kills my productivity during work hours with my iPad.

|It’s very fun and I enjoy the levels, but there are a few issues. As of now, it’s hard to do precise cuts because you can’t adjust where your first touch is, and there is a simple fix. Update it and add two finger touch slicing, it would make it so much better. The difficulty is a bit weird, like they will often have harder levels, and then throw in an easy one, I don’t know if this done intentionally or not. There are also some levels that at least in my experience is down to fine detail. Which wouldn’t be a problem, except like I said it’s hard to be precise. Then there is the problem of the adds, but there’s a fix that works for most games. Instead of putting your phone on airplane mode and not being able to text, call, or be texted or called, you can turn off your wifi and wait for it to give you an add. Then, go into your settings and scroll down to the game click on it and turn off data usage. Now you can resume your game without wifi and no adds. I’ve also heard you can turn airplane mode on launch the app and then turn airplane mode off but i haven’t tested that.

|The accuracy needed to do precision cuts is lacking. Overall, a fun game but the number and frequency of ads increase to the point you either have them removed or delete the game. If enjoying a game I’m prone to pay to have the ads removed though that still leaves you at the publishers mercy as to how many “game ads” they roll into the developers portfolio as these are not considered ads. The logic of this escapes me which leaves only greed as the motivation. Therein lies the problem with the price being set at $4.99. Since the shift from purchase to “free” games, the cost for entertainment has skyrocketed but $4.99 just to remove ads is high in comparison to other games offering the same. I’ll delete this game as it is neither unique nor enjoyable enough to justify the price. Also, since I’m already paying with the more expensive commodity of time spent viewing ads (money you can make. Time not so available.) to play I’m disgusted being forced to pay an addition monetary amount that is overly inflated. We consumers are be herded into acceptance. This trend needs to be stopped at some point. This is game and price is my limit.

|Helix Jump is such a great game! So far I’m at level 40, the game is so addictive I can’t stop playing! It’s challenging without being impossible and once you pass a few levels you want to keep going, once I got to level 20 I noticed a change. Instead of the levels getting harder or staying at the same level they started to get easier, 2 levels didn’t even have ‘death spots’ this was kind of confusing and made me think about deleting the game. When I went through a few levels I realized this stopped happening and didn’t delete it, but th levels did stop getting harder. If you changed this I would give the game 5 stars. Over all this game is really fun and is great if you’re looking for a simple game to help you pass time, I do have one request though, could you have a home ‘button’ or screen to take a break and look through ball and splash options? I know you can do this on the first ring in the game but it’s hard to control and sometimes I end up playing instead of browsing (does that make sense?) another thing is the adds they aren’t very annoying and are often short or you can exit back to the game but there are quit a few of them, the game is still great and the adds don’t get in the way of playing but I thought it would be nice to warn review readers. This is such a great game and I love playing, I 100% recommended it and hope you have fun playing!

|I have had Helix Jump for a while now, and I absolutely love it. I play it basically whenever I can. The game is great, but there are a couple things that aren’t so awesome about it.First things first: ads. Yeah, I get that ads are a way to make money for the game, but they are used way too much. They pop up just about every time you die or pass a level, which is super annoying. And when you start a level? There’s one that pops up on the side and on the bottom. I just want to play my game, not have to continually x-out of ads and the App Store. Although, in the big picture, ads aren’t that big a deal. One thing that is definitely a bigger problem is this: after I watch an ad for a second chance, the game drops me a few rings down, usually onto a ‘red zone’ so I die and lose whatever score I had, and I can’t even watch another ad to try again. The app should at least give you a 3 second countdown so you don’t die right off. A final problem is that I can’t get the final helix. It’s not that big a deal, but I want to know what it is. It says ‘Unlock 5 skins’ to get but I have all the other ones and it still says 0/5. I’ve noticed some other reviews that mention the same thing, so it’s obviously been a problem for a while. Please fix it!Other than those few issues, Helix Jump is a great game. If they were fixed, I would definitely give this five stars.

|So what I love to do is try to get as many boosts as possible. Who wouldn’t? It’s already a really fun and very addicting game, and the boosts make it much more exciting, but here’s the problem: I bounced before I hit the boost, which gives the player a little extra time to survey the next helixes. I noticed another boost before the next set of helixes so I took it. Then came another boost. And another one. And another one. After five boosts, I was soaring to the bottom of the tower........... and then the game glitched. Rather than there being a landing platform at the bottom of the tower, there was nothing there, and I just kept falling and falling and falling. This didn’t affect me that much because I wasn’t trying to break any personal records, but this could largely affect players who are trying to break theirs. My guess is that because the game saw so many boosts being hit, it ended up accidentally destroying the landing platform.If you guys could fix this that would be great! Thank you.I’m not done yet, though.This has been in the game probably since it was released: many (or all—I don’t know) people can’t get the last ball (unlock 5 skins). I’ve unlocked every skin except for this one but I can never get it. It would be great if you could fix this so I, and many others, could get the last skin. Thank you!

description: WhatsApp Messenger is a FREE messaging app available for iPhone and other smartphones. WhatsApp uses your phone's Internet connection (4G/3G/2G/EDGE or Wi-Fi, as available) to let you message and call friends and family. Switch from SMS to WhatsApp to send and receive messages, calls, photos, videos, and Voice Messages. WHY USE WHATSAPP: • NO FEES: WhatsApp uses your phone's Internet connection (4G/3G/2G/EDGE or Wi-Fi, as available) to let you message and call friends and family, so you don't have to pay for every message or call.* There are no subscription fees to use WhatsApp.• MULTIMEDIA: Send and receive photos, videos, and Voice Messages. • FREE CALLS: Call your friends and family for free with WhatsApp Calling, even if they're in another country.* WhatsApp calls use your phone's Internet connection rather than your cellular plan's voice minutes. (Note: Data charges may apply. Contact your provider for details. Also, you can't access 911 and other emergency service numbers through WhatsApp). • GROUP CHAT: Enjoy group chats with your contacts so you can easily stay in touch with your friends or family.• WHATSAPP WEB: You can also send and receive WhatsApp messages right from your computer's browser.• NO INTERNATIONAL CHARGES: There's no extra charge to send WhatsApp messages internationally. Chat with your friends around the world and avoid international SMS charges.* • SAY NO TO USERNAMES AND PINS: Why bother having to remember yet another username or PIN? WhatsApp works with your phone number, just like SMS, and integrates seamlessly with your phone's existing address book. • ALWAYS LOGGED IN: With WhatsApp, you're always logged in so you don't miss messages. No more confusion about whether you're logged in or logged out. • QUICKLY CONNECT WITH YOUR CONTACTS: Your address book is used to quickly and easily connect you with your contacts who have WhatsApp so there's no need to add hard-to-remember usernames.• OFFLINE MESSAGES: Even if you miss your notifications or turn off your phone, WhatsApp will save your recent messages until the next time you use the app.• AND MUCH MORE: Share your location, exchange contacts, set custom wallpapers and notification sounds, email chat history, broadcast messages to multiple contacts at once, and more!*Data charges may apply. Contact your provider for details. --------------------------------------------------------- We're always excited to hear from you! If you have feedback, questions, or concerns, please email us at: iphone-support@whatsapp.com or follow us on twitter: http://twitter.com/WhatsApp@WhatsApp---------------------------------------------------------Note: WhatsApp is a telephony app, so iPod and iPad are not supported devices.

reviews:
|This app would be nearing perfection if it weren’t for the horror that occurs when you get a new SIM card. This app is loosely catered to world travelers and yet every time you pop in a new sim with a new number .. if you dare to switch numbers in-app you will completely wipe out all of your connections , you’ll lose access to every previous group chat, people trying to message your old number will never get a hold of you unless you pro-actively message them. How about someone you haven’t spoken to for a while?.. someone for whom it’s awkward to randomly shoot off a message saying “hey this is my new number” ... for years I was working around this by NEVER updating my number so my WA number was tethered to a dead SIM card from a country I hadn’t even been in for years... anyone with my current contact info wouldn’t be able to find me unless I committed contact holocaust and started my WA life anew.. I will say though that the “reply to message” feature basically makes this the greatest messaging app in the world .. it boggles my mind that other apps actively refuse to add this simple and necessary feature.

|I’m so blessed that I am living up to the age of 66 and can enjoy the esp. the phone facility on what’s app!!Now we can use what’s app all over the world to talk with our near and dear ones. What to talk about overseas calls to use phone for local calls in India was a dream. Not everyone could have/ or afford to have phone in their homes. And I remember if one home had telephone how all the neighbors in emergency used that phone. And oh! Trunk calls if the call was placed out of the city. Had to wait for the operator to connect us. And to call from USA to India was always painful because we talked to our family but constantly looked at he click as not to talk more than 5-10 minutes. It was pretty expensive. And now people are chatting for hours with their family and friends! Wow it is a blessing to have what’s App! Long live and all our blessings to all the people who invented this App! What an invention and what a technology!Every time I use what’s app to call my family I bless the person and technology who gave us this opportunity to do so .Thanks!!

|This app was once quite useful, but it’s caught facebook-messenger-disease — regular nag screens asking for permissions it doesn’t have. Also, after not opening it for a very long time (but keeping it installed, so occasionally updating to the latest version w/ everything else) it 1) sent me a lock screen notification, something I had *not* given permission for it to do, because 2) background app refresh was on, which I did *not* give it permission for either — again, it hadn’t been run in month! — and 3) the notification said I’d been added to "BAD BOYS 😀 AND BAD GIRLS" by some stranger; after I searched for how to mark this group as spam and block I 4) received an immediate request for WhatsApp to access my camera *while I was not using the app, because the same stranger had tried to vid call me*, after which I searched for how to block the stranger themselves… a foolish waste of time from a product that’s spoiled once the garbage people at Facebook had their way with it. This app and product are compromised. Avoid if you have any option. ...and if a Facebook employee is reading this? *Quit your job at that disgusting company before it ruins you. Your actions are objectively making the world a worse place*. F-.

|This game is fire in the the form of games.😂 Jk obviously. But this game is really tons of fun! But seriously I was like addicted to this game but I just made it to level 999 yesterday, I noticed where it normally says the next level, it just was gray/black. Huh? Right! So after I finished level 999, IT TOOK ME RIGHT BACK!!! THERES NO LEVEL 1000!!! WHAT? Crazy huh? Made me soooo sad and kinda annoyed! I mean, the levels are decently easy after you play, so did voodoo really think people couldn’t get to level 1,000 or something? Idk! But 2nd problem..... theres just too many ads! Like there isn’t so many that you honestly can’t play, but it’s a little too much for me! And clearly some others...😂 But yes, plz fix these problems! ESPECIALLY THE 1ST ONE! Cause think about it, if you can’t get to the next level and it makes you play the same one OVER AND OVER! Would you really want to play the game anymore? No! Exactly!😂 So you’ll have no choice but to just delete the game! And after all that hard work too!👎🏼 So yes, please get these problems fixed! Thanks for reading if you did! ♥️

|Edit same day: so I've paid for add free, but adds keep popping up and after it does the continue glitch and I have to watch an ad AGAIN, it does away after that level and remembers that I've purchased no ads. I want you to fix it. If I paid for something it should work.Old:As the other reviewers had said the adds were insane but I liked the game for it simply wasting time and to occupy myself / my nieces and nephews. I did however pay for the add free and I like it a heck of a lot more. If you get it just restart the app after or else the adds will continue so long as you are in that session. I was angry and was going to come here and write a bad report but I accidently opened it back up and no more adds! So every time I died I didn't have to wait to restart and continue. And the continue button did dissapear, but you just tap the screen again to start up as if it were there. It needs improvement but it's simply a game. I hope the payment helps in its development and allows for them to create something for the diamonds lol. Until then I'll just keep collecting them in hopes they will turn into something.

|So I’d say that this app is really fun, but there are some problems. First, there are many adds. Oddly it seems that some days it’s better than others 🤔. Second the levels are a bit funky. Personally I struggled a lot on some levels. The way that they order the levels is very odd. I believe I got stuck one one level for about 3 days and I would be so mad that I couldn’t pass this one level. I t made me want to delete the app and break items around me. Eventually I had my friend pass the level for me. The odd thing though was that the 15 levels after that were super easy and I passed them on my first try. The last thing that I would ask for the creators to fix is limited levels. I have ben very “addicted” to this game, so I passed many levels. I was so excited when I got to level 999, because I really wanted to get to 1,000. However, THERE ISN’T A LEVEL 1,000!! So right now the app is just taking up space on my phone and since you can’t go backwards to previous levels there is nothing to do on the app.

|I had bitmoji for a while a couple years ago and deleted it. No one was really using it and it got boring for me. I decided to redownload the app when my friends on snapchat began using it. I find a lot of them to be hilarious, so I’ve had fun incorporating them into my everyday phone conversations.That said, I have two issues with the app. One minor issue - why isn’t there a search function in the app to find bitmojis? Scrolling through them is nice just to see what’s randomly there, but when I’m texting and looking for something specific, it’d be nice to have the option to narrow it down more quickly. Which brings me to my second, bigger issue.Someone reading this might say - you can do that with the keyboard... why aren’t you using that? Well, when I went to integrate bitmoji with my text app, a notification popped up saying something along the lines of I would be giving permission for the app to access my texts, even past texts. That really bothered me. Why would the app need access to my past text messages? Like what purpose does that serve? So I declined, and I copy bitmojis straight from the app instead. Lengthier process, sure, but I really only use them with one person anyway.So I’d like an in-app search feature if possible. :)

|Dear everyone,I would like to say that I love this game! But there are always improvements that can be done. For example: maybe some more hairstyles (I know after the update they put new ones but like more for people with short hair, cause no hair matches mine), more lip styles (I’m sure everyone can agree on this one), piercings! I have ear piercings but I always wanted a nose one and lastly FASHION!!!!!! I always had this idea of that you can create your OWN outfits so, you go in the game go to the clothes and create it! So like...you want a croptop BAM you got it, want it white with some designs? BAM you got it! Want some high waisted short? BAM you already know...YOU GOT IT! Want some nikies ... YOU GOT IT!!! And then of course just decorate your outfit, maybe a necklace and some bracelets! And then..yea, you’re done! Now I wanna say something first before I finish this review, I in no way am trying to take over this game these are just some ideas I got and thought maybe I should share them. Everyone can help! So don’t hate because *you think* I’m trying to take over the game. They made it, it’s there’s. Love you all, stay kind ♥️-XOXO 🙂

|Bitmoji is an amazing app! Weather you use it for SnapChat,Texting, whatever! I enjoy how you can customize your own little you. But there is so many ways that you could make bitmoji an even more amazing app! First off more fashion! There is already lots of clothes to choose from, but try to put even more in the app more frequently and that would be fantastic! Second, you should be able to customize even more, like your height, the length of your hairstyle, and have more options for breast sizes. Thirdly, you should be able to change the color of clothing. When I go to pick a different clothing item I want and it’s bright pink or some color that I don’t want I no longer want to wear that item, there should be an option to change the color of the clothing item. Finally, please consider being able to mix and match items, like have and an option to ‘mix clothing’ and select the items you want to mix. Please take this into consideration it and I would give it 5 stars, it would also make the app so much more amazing! But overall I totally recommend this app over any other, it is amazing!♥️♥️♥️

reviews:
|Okay so first of all I’m super addicted to this game and it’s super fun and I love it and I haven’t gotten tired of it yet BUT I do feel like I have some good ideas that could help the game be even better. So my first idea is one that I’ve already seen people suggest before and it’s that there should be more than place to play at, maybe do a farm or another planet or different cities/towns from different countries, maybe even do one that’s an amusement park. There’s tons of different maps you could make. My other suggestion is that there be a ‘free play’ added where there’s no time limit and you play by yourself until you’ve eaten the whole town because personally I really just like the satisfaction of eating everything and I think it would be fun to have that as an option. I also think that another good idea would be adding power ups during the game while you’re playing; I’d say you could either do the power ups randomly during the game or you could have them as an option to purchase with artificial money before you play a game. The ‘money’ to purchase these power ups could come from the ‘kills’ you make in each game. And as you ‘kill’ more they add up and turn into credits after each game to where eventually you could use them to buy different power ups. Okay that’s all I have for now and I really hope to see some of these come into play!

|First off I would just like to say that this is probably one of the worst designed apps that I have ever downloaded. It’s glitchy, annoying, riddled with bugs, and honestly just doesn’t have a very user friendly interface. Fist off let me just say that the speeds of the different sized holes are ridiculous. How is it that a hole 18 times bigger than me can move so much faster? And another thing, the people who get big in the beginning (I’m talking about the battle royal type mode) basically win the game. It is really hard for someone to get big in the beginning and the people who can EASILY win the game over all of the smaller pictures. It’s stupid that there Games last about 2 minuets and they have the audacity to make you watch an ad after every game. Now I know about the no ads purchase but honestly it’s not worth it for a game that I only play when I have nothing better to do. On top of this there are huge graphical glitches, things like buildings flying across to the other side of the map, and objects sinking below to physical map. On top of all this it really doesn’t seem to it would be too hard for them to fix this (but I’m not a developer so I don’t know) and this game could easily be one of the most fun free time games In the App Store if they fixed these. The reason that I’m giving this a four star review is because if you can look past all of these problems then it is really fun.

|The concept of this game is really amazing. It’s a fun mechanic and you really have to eat used to the physics, it’s challenging to eat things when small but just as challenging when you ran a group of buildings and they all get stuck trying to go down. I notice some choppy lag when you’re getting bigger, hopefully some polishing can be done to make that a little better. My major complaint is the game modes, and I can’t understand how the devs went wrong on this. You have a 2 minute top score mode against a bunch of computer players which is somewhat interesting but tires quickly. Next, you have a battle mode with no time limit, but the bots will zero in on you when they know they’re bigger than you so it feels unfair and rushed. Outside of local multiplayer, you have a solo mode that makes the game, no bots to deal with and no goals besides eating everything... but again you have only two minutes. It can take a quarter of that time just to find things to get bigger when you’re small, and by the time you’re just big enough to have fun you’re out of time. Why do this??? This type of mode needs more time, but honestly a solo mode with no time limit at all would be an absolute game-changer, pitting all these restrictions on the fun hollows the experience and leaves you frustrated and wanting more. I would love to increase the rating if the devs would allow us to enjoy the game the way we should be able to, it just doesn’t make sense not to.

description: Take a trip through Looper - a joyous, melodious casual game that puts your sense of rhythm and timing to the test.Every tap starts a colourful new beat that travels along increasingly complex constellations - get your timing wrong and the beats could crash and burn. Get it right, however, and experience the simple satisfaction of looping harmony.Featuring hundreds of unique levels, each designed to sooth and satisfy your puzzling needs. Looper is a music puzzle game like no other.SUBSCRIBE TO LOOPER! Subscribe to Looper! for all of the following benefits:* The Remove Ads product, which removes non-optional adverts from the game * ALL Levels unlocked, including 20 special levels* Unlimited free solutions * 3 VIP beats * Exclusive music SUBSCRIPTIONS INFORMATION: Looper! VIP Membership access offers two membership options:1) A weekly subscription costing $5.49 per week after a 3 day FREE trial period.2) A monthly subscription costing $14.49 per month.After buying this subscription, you will unlock and remove non-optional ads product, which removes non-optional adverts from the game, all levels will be unlocked, including 20 special levels, you will have access to unlimited free solutions to levels, you will get 3 VIP beats that can be used in game and receive exclusive music to use in the game. This is an auto-renewable subscription. The payment is charged to your account after confirmation. The subscription is renewed unless you unsubscribe 24 hours before the period ends. Your account will also be charged for renewalThe prices notes are for United States customers. Pricing in other countries may change and actual charges may be converted to local currency.End of trial and subscription renewal:- The payment is charged to your iTunes account after a confirmation of purchase- The subscription is renewed unless you unsubscribe 24 hours before the end of the current period- The account will be charged for renewal 24 hours before the end of the current period at the standard cost of the weekly subscription- The user may manage the subscription and auto-renewal by accessing the user's account settings after purchase in the store- No cancellation of the current subscription is permitted during the active subscription period- Any unused portion of the free trial period will be forfeited when the subscription is purchasedCancelling a trial or subscription:- In order to cancel a subscription during the free trial period you need to cancel it through your account in the Store. This must be done at least 24 hours before the end of the free trial period to avoid being charged.

reviews:
|TLDR: Gameplay is creative and fun but you get a 30 second ad for every 5 seconds of gameplay.I saw this game from an advertisement from another game that I was playing. I usually don’t find games like that but this one looked like a lot of good fun. And it is! It’s relaxing and fun to just mindlessly play. The only problem is, the amount of ads there are. I see that there are tons of complaints about this already but maybe one more will push them further to change. I’m completely okay with having ads, I didn’t pay for the game, why shouldn’t I have ads? But they take it to a new level. The levels are designed to only take seconds to complete (or fail until you get it). When you finish one you’re very ready for the next! But what do you get? An add that is longer than your gameplay. They should at LEAST be a minute apart! But when you solve a puzzle in 10 seconds then get an ad for 30 seconds, it’s really aggravating. I hope they realize that even though they’re getting money for the ads, less and less people are going to play it for very long and then they won’t have money for the long run. It’s just sad because it IS a great game. But unless you love to watch ads, wait until they fix it.

|It’s a fun game, but they have gone way overboard with the ads. A 30 second ad for winning or losing a level gets annoying. That would be like a Mario game where losing a life makes you watch an ad. I get it, developers need money, and ads are a good way to do it when implemented properly. However, that hasn’t been the case, as most of the other reviews say. Personally, I’m at level 58, but the ads have gone insane at this point. It wasn’t bad at the first few levels, but then the amount exponentially increased. It’s also pointless that I have to watch an ad just to be able to change skins (what the game refers to as beats), which is basically 1 step down from paying for a cosmetic change. I am well aware that I can turn off WiFi, however, I still see ads even if I do so. Even if it worked, I don’t see why that should be accepted as a solution. There is an option to pay to not have to watch “non optional” ads (ads that don’t appear from things like -1 beat or the solution), but that’s still giving them money. At this point, how about their next update does nothing except run a cryptocurrency miner in the background? That wouldn’t surprise me.

|When I saw this game pop up as an ad on another game I was like “Oh, that looks cool.” So I downloaded the app, and Immediately found a problem. The game is great, I love how it uses beats, they add more creativity to the game. BUT after every single level or every single time you fail (which is a lot, the game is quite challenging, but addictive) you get an ad! And to make it worse, they are 30+ seconds long and you can’t skip them. An ad after every 10 or so levels is fine, but not EVERY TIME you fail or pass a level. That is just ridiculous. I get that you have to have ads in order for an app to make money, but that many ads, and the fact that we see the same 3 over and over again, just makes you really not want to buy the game the ad is advertising.I really like this game, but it’s practically impossible to play with all the ads. They are driving me crazy, and the game isn’t fun anymore. If you fix this problem I will be glad to re-download the app, but for now I’m just going to have to delete it. Please take my, and everyone else’s words who wrote about this problem into consideration. This game could be much better without all the ads.

|After I do a search on the app, I get the results, and of course, there’s hundreds and/or thousands of items that I filter through. I would scroll/browse though the list of items and select one of the items for more info on it, and then tap the “back” button (arrow) to get back to the browsing list. However, when I tap the back button, it sends me all the way to the top of the list. That’s very annoying after having scrolled through such a long list of items, meaning that I’m having to scroll back through every thing again and again every time I select one item for more info. Is there any way to fix this? I have the latest update, so I know that’s not the problem. Essentially, it’s time-consuming, annoying, and makes you NOT want to continue to look for something to buy. Please fix.UPDATE: Issues have gotten worse. Even with the update, the app lags horribly, it crashes in the middle of me browsing, and it goes into “still loading” mode for forever until I hit the back button and try again. It froze today when I pressed checkout while buying an item, and only after getting out of the app and then opening it up again, could I finally see that the payment went through. Please fix this buggy app.

|I have a habit of reviewing the items I purchased to help other potential buyers make their decisions. While I am able to post reviews from the mobile app, it is a bit cumbersome. I wish there was an option of selecting multiple pictures instead of hitting add photo, finding a photo and then repeating over and over. I’ve also had issues with either adding a previously recorded video, or taking a video through the app. A lot of times it will say there is an issue with the file and to please select another file. This is particularly frustrating if I record a detailed video that while under five minutes in length, I find out I have to do again and hope that it takes it. Please fix the reviewing aspect of the app! Otherwise everything else I’ve experienced with it is great! I’ve had no issues making purchases, or tracking my items or anything.

description: Uber is a ridesharing app for fast, reliable rides in minutes – day or night. There’s no need to park or wait for a taxi or bus. With Uber, you just tap to request a ride, and it’s easy to pay with credit card or cash (in selected cities only). Whether you’re going to the airport or across town, there’s an Uber for every occasion. Uber is available in more than 500 cities worldwide – download the app and take your first trip today.Requesting your Uber is easy – here’s how it works:- Just open the app and tell us where you want to go.- The app uses your location so your driver knows where to pick you up.- You’ll see your driver’s picture and vehicle details, and can track their arrival on the map.- Payment can be made by credit card, cash (in selected cities only), Apple Pay, PayPal and more.- After the ride, you can rate your driver and provide feedback to help us improve the Uber experience. You’ll also get a receipt by email.Need a simple way to get from A to B quickly? Take uberX, our most affordable option for individual travel.Want to save money on your ride? Take uberPOOL – you’ll travel with other riders heading in the same direction, and enjoy a lower fare.Want a more exclusive experience? Take a high-end vehicle with UberBLACK. And there are even more options – whether you’re travelling with a big group or need a vehicle with accessibility features.See if Uber is available in your city at https://www.uber.com/citiesFollow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/uberLike us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/uberGot a question? Visit uber.com/help.Note: continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.

reviews:
|I wish to let Uber management know that I am a very satisfied customer. The Uber service is great their drivers are well trained they’re nice to people and the cars are very good. I am legally blind and DAS use the Uber constantly. I have a recommendation to make in order for the application to be even more useful and the service as well to people like myself who have low vision or are legally blind or blind. It would be a good idea if Uber sent a picture of me of the passenger to the driver before the pick up time in order for the driver to be able to identify the passenger. Needless to say that being legally blind I cannot see the driver however the driver can’t see me if they have the picture it would just make it much easier on both of us during pick up time especially in crowded places. I also wish for Uber to participate in the para transit or special transportation service also known as STS in Miami Dade County Florida. I know that there are other cities such as Boston Massachusetts and Alta Monte Springs in Florida which allow Uber in all the ridesharing services to participate and supplement the para transit or special transportation program. This would give us people with low vision blind or with any disability the opportunity to have transportation on demand and not have to call in advance 24 hours and at the same time have to wait for other people to travel and to be dropped off

|Complaints always seem to be first on the mind when rating. So before launching that, I will say that the quality of service is higher than all others in the same class of rider apps and service. However, the change to anonymous calls to drivers and anonymous texts is highly questionable since its the only option. And who could blame them for not answering. It’s not like one is likely to be calling to chat about the weather. Rather the normal scenario is that the time to arrival just doubled, car is headed in the opposite direction than the app indicates and you are already 15 minutes late for your appointment because the past two drivers cancelled the ride after you waited 8-10 minutes. And Uber has no customer service in real time- so at best you can report whatever and a couple of days later you will receive a well groomed response but in real time you are on your own. Transportation in NYC has been revolutionized by rider apps. And some are actually cheaper than the old stalwart, a yellow cab. But that’s not our Uber which is at the top range on average but doesn’t spike to ridiculous 4-5x normal price during special periods quite as egregiously as one of its competitors. So if you are new to the city, take the tips and if you are Uber, do better since you are absolutely being paid to do and if not, another will fill the gap. That’s what rider apps have in their future according to my hopeful prediction.

reviews:
|Pandora is smart with assuming what music relates to my chosen bands. They are a little narrow in their offerings from any individual band. For example, if choose a “station” called Supertramp I heat Supertramp’s greatest hits over and over again, which is fine, but if I choose a station based on a specific band, it is safe to assume I like more than just their most popular songs. I should hear their entire catalog. If I choose a genre-based station it is okay to play just hits from various bands in that genre, but if I pick a specific band, Pandora should be smart enough to realize I want everything from that band, not just their hit songs.I also have a frequent connectivity issue. I live in a rural area where it is not uncommon to lose cellular coverage and subsequently my Pandora feed. No problem, I understand this is unavoidable. The problem is that when I regain cellular connectivity Pandora often will not reboot. About half the time I have to turn my phone completely off to get Pandora to restart. This is not safe when I am driving so I either have to pull over or live without Pandora until I get to my destination. I have an iPhone 6s with Apple CarPlay in my vehicle.I love Pandora except for these two issues. Thanks,Mike Kingsley

|I listen to Ryan Farish radio on Pandora Plus everyday. So relaxing. It has become an addiction. I connect it to my car audio via Bluetooth on the iPhone app and play it on Roku TV while reading, surfing the net and relaxing. I listen to Pandora more than I watch TV. It has a great selection of new age/trance instrumental artists like Ryan Farish (of course), 7 and 5, and Deosil. It throws in some classical, soft jazz, and EDM for variety. Even my bunny likes it! I tried Premium but went back down to Plus. I don’t skip much because it plays most of the music I like that has a thumbs up. I also just like to listen to the music randomly. Most of the songs and artists I like most, could not be replayed or added to playlist on Premium anyways due to licensing. Which is ridiculous considering you’re paying the extra money that should cover this. Another downside is the replay/back button won’t work in the car. I can skip forward using the car’s track button on the steering wheel, but back to replay the song won’t work, especially if the song cannot be replayed because of licensing. I also found the Premium app too confusing. Other than that, love this music. Could listen to it forever.

|Constantly goes offline when I have plenty of service. Now it won’t play the songs on my playlists. I select a song and it chooses a random song from the same playlist. I have premium yet your licensing restrictions require that a lot of the songs I like require to be listened to on the radio part of the app. What’s the point of paying for premium? I’d rather deal with ads. I listen to this app while I’m driving and now with our distracted driving laws in my state this app makes it IMPOSSIBLE for me to get it working if it starts wigging out on me. The offline playlists literally play crap music and only play like four songs. When you go back into service it chooses a playlist for you instead of resuming what you had going in the first place. This app is a total waste of money for premium and a total waste of time and effort for commuters without premium. Like if I want to listen to a song over, sure I will listen to an ad but don’t prompt me 7 times about premium before letting me rewind like seriously how am I supposed to listen and drive when the app is asking you 20 freaking questions. Stop making things more of an effort than they need to be. The other day I selected a song and it started randomly playing other songs on that playlist but then immediately choosing another and another and so on. My songs were on a literal shuffle. Get your life together pandora.

|Tik Tok is a great app to use if you just want to pass time, but they come with massive compromises. They restrict your followers because of some anti-spam thing they created. In my opinion if your fans follow you you should follow them. Tik Tok doesn’t help with that especially if you want to get big in the social media world. They restrict how many videos you can like, and if you feel like commenting on the video the restrict the amount of characters you can use in that comment. It is probably based off of a study they did seeing the average amount of characters people use in a comment, but it has hurt me more than helped me most of the time I go to comment something. Now I have to rush and type up the rest of my comment before someone else posts a comment. Imagine trying to do that when people all around the world are posting comments like that, it is nearly impossible to do that. Every time I have posted a comment there is usually 4,5, and sometimes even more posted comments between my original post and the rest of my post. Then when you want to watch a live video, which is a great feature of Tik Tok btw, and you want to talk to the user that is hosting the live video the characters that you can type in that space is limited. You can’t even chat with someone because your speech is so broken up. There is a limit of, I want to say 50 characters, and yes that includes spaces. That is barely enough to say anything.

|Ever since the new tik tok update all my friends have left because it doesn’t feel the same way as it did in 2015,2016,2017 . So the creators of TikTok (musically) please have an actual person respond to this message and give me a raw ( actually way you feel the real person responding) response to if you would bring the old musically or all the old features of musically back PLEASE RESPOND! 👐and if you say no then please tell me why thank you for your time .

|TIKTOK is an awesome app! So much to do and explore! There app is literally so fun to play around with! TikTok has so many things to do and there are great things on this app. There are so many fun filters to use when making a video! There are also celebrities on this app! Like Halsey, Cardi B, and Ariana Grande!! TikTok is also a very caring app. They donated to 3 different charities every time someone made a video with the charities filter! reviews:
|Creative Destruction follows very closely to the other BR mobile games, and that isn’t necessarily bad. One of the ways that they have tried to make it different is by having characters talk. This isn’t a good idea! When you get on the Air Taxi, every single time there’s an annoying voice line from someone that lasts the entire length of the flight. And since there’s only about 3 different lines, you here the same speeches again and again and again and again!Also, the hammer dude is okay, but him talking as well is a bit unnecessary. Along with this, the ‘tutorial’ isn’t actually over when you get to the menu; your first game is basically just bots, so it’s an easy win for everyone. As with most mobile games, there’s so much stuff on the menu that’s trying to get you to buy things that you might as well give up on trying to get anything with just the in-game currency. At the beginning of each game there’s a sequence where the “best dressed” players are shown off. Again just another scheme to get people to buy things with real money. Then again, it’s a free app so what can you expect.Other than that, the game performs well for even an iPhone 6 (unlike Fortnite cough cough) and it’s fun to play with yourself and with others. Great job to the CD team for making this a great game.

|Ok, so I feel like when this game first came out, it’s obviously just a plain copy of Fortnite. But I feel like with the recent updates, this game is becoming more of its own thing instead of just a Fortnite clone. The devs are definitely heading in the right direction. I feel like this game has HUGE potential that’s just not really being taken advantage of. Like putting this game on major consoles like xBox One, PS4, Nintendo Switch, etc would REALLY help this game take off. As for feedback about the game currently, it’s pretty decent. The servers are mostly not too laggy, good weapon variety, (though some are not very balanced, and the SMGs are basically ARs with a super high fire rate) the cosmetics are decent, and the gameplay is pretty smooth. Adding custom HUDs would be nice, and sometimes the game just doesn’t feel very smooth. Also, I’ve noticed sometimes after you see a hit marker, it takes a bit for the damage to show up. And I’m not sure how damage is determined, but it’s definitely not just head/body shot with drop off. Sometimes with an AK-47 I hit for 6 damage to the head, next shot I hit like 100 to the head. Overall, decent game with huge potential that’s definitely in the right direction.

|Got the game soon as it came out to try it out I thought it was just another knock off game trying to be Fortnite but where I feel Fortnite failed I think creative destruction succeed which was in controls. Anyways I’m not that high in rank or anything I’m level 13 and silver rank. It’s been about a week so, but I logged on that evening and spent $10 I didn’t spend the jems yet though wanted to save them to get one of the new permanent costumes from this last update. Well right after that I qued myself for a match and it didn’t work I kept trying I thought it was my signal maybe so I closed the app and tried again and I noticed after I tried starting any match it gave a super brief text saying “you are banned from starting a match.” So my question is, first of all why was I banned for no reason? Secondly, why wasn’t I notified that I was banned and lastly why wasn’t I given a reason for the ban ? I want a refund of my $10 (jems still unused) because I can’t even play that’s unacceptable. I’ve already put in several reports and haven’t gotten any replies in a week. As for anyone reading this don’t spend any more what so ever in this game, there is no “RESTORE PURCHASES” option in this game, don’t get me wrong the game is fun but don’t spend any money it’s not worth it people are getting banned left and right for no reasons just poor programming and it isn’t fair to the player.
